result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Enrique Pedrero-Hernandez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Enrique Pedrero-Hernandez in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Enrique Pedrero-Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Enrique Pedrero-Hernandez in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Enrique Pedrero-Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  
Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Enrique Pedrero-Hernandez in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense counsel in need of an offer and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 06-28-2022, received and filed
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Enrique Pedrero-Hernandez in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Enrique Pedrero-Hernandez in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Pedrero-Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
